"The Discovery of Penicillin": A movie about the discovery of penicillin by Scottish scientist Alexander Fleming in 1928. The film follows Fleming's journey from his humble beginnings as a country doctor to his groundbreaking discovery that revolutionized modern medicine. The movie would highlight the challenges he faced in convincing the medical community of the importance of his discovery and the ethical dilemmas he encountered in the face of widespread disease and death.

"The Battle of Midway": A historical action-thriller that reimagines the famous World War II naval battle as a tense and suspenseful action-packed movie. The film would follow the stories of the sailors and pilots involved in the battle, showcasing their bravery and sacrifice as they fought against the odds to turn the tide of the war.

"The Renaissance of Leonardo da Vinci": A biographical drama that explores the life and work of Leonardo da Vinci, focusing on the period in the late 1400s when he was at the height of his creative powers. The movie would delve into his artistic, scientific, and engineering achievements, showcasing his groundbreaking inventions and his pioneering work in fields such as anatomy and engineering.

"The Age of Exploration": A historical epic that chronicles the Age of Exploration, a period in the 15th and 16th centuries when European explorers set out to discover new lands and map the world. The movie would follow the adventures of famous explorers such as Christopher Columbus, Vasco da Gama, and Ferdinand Magellan, highlighting their bravery, determination, and the challenges they faced in their quest for discovery.

"The Emancipation Proclamation": A historical drama that tells the story of the Emancipation Proclamation, issued by President Abraham Lincoln in 1863, which freed millions of enslaved African Americans. The movie would explore the political and social landscape of the time, highlighting the struggles and sacrifices of those who fought for freedom and equality, and the ongoing legacy of the Emancipation Proclamation in American society today.
